definition.en: to send or direct someone or something along a different route (often because the usual way is blocked or not ideal)
definition.zh: （因道路封闭、拥堵等）将某人/某物改道，改走另一条路线

examples.en: The police rerouted traffic away from the accident.
examples.zh: 警方把车流改道，避开事故现场。

examples.en: Our flight was rerouted due to bad weather.
examples.zh: 由于恶劣天气，我们的航班被改航线了。

examples.en: Can you reroute this delivery to our new address?
examples.zh: 你能把这单配送改送到我们的新地址吗？

definition.en: (of traffic, flights, or signals) to go by a different route
definition.zh: （车流、航班或信号）改走另一条路线，改道

examples.en: When the main road closed, buses rerouted through downtown.
examples.zh: 主干道关闭后，公交车改道穿过市中心。

examples.en: Internet traffic rerouted automatically after the outage.
examples.zh: 断线后，网络流量自动改道。

definition.en: a change of route; the act of sending something a different way
definition.zh: 改道；改线；改路（这一行为或结果）

examples.en: The app suggested a reroute to avoid heavy traffic.
examples.zh: 应用建议改道以避开严重拥堵。

examples.en: We had to make a reroute because the bridge was closed.
examples.zh: 因为桥封了，我们不得不改道。

extraExplanation: “reroute”由前缀 re-（再次/重新）+ route（路线）构成，常用于交通、物流、航班与网络/通信领域。
在美式英语中常见搭配：reroute traffic（改道车流）、reroute a flight（改航班/改航线）、reroute a package（改寄包裹）、reroute calls（电话转接/改线路）。
与 detour 的区别：detour 常指“绕行的那条路/绕行本身”（更偏“绕路”），reroute 更强调“把原本的路线重新安排到另一条路线”。

summary.en: “Rerouted” means something was directed onto a different route than planned.
summary.zh: “rerouted”表示某人或某物被改道，改走与原计划不同的路线。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “reroute”: to send or direct someone or something along a different route than originally planned.
definition.zh: “reroute”的过去式/过去分词：把某人或某物改道，改用与原计划不同的路线。

examples.en: Due to an accident, traffic was rerouted onto side streets.
examples.zh: 由于发生事故，车辆被改道到附近的支路上。

examples.en: The airline rerouted our flight through Chicago because of the storm.
examples.zh: 因为暴风雨，航空公司把我们的航班改道经由芝加哥中转。

examples.en: Customer calls were rerouted to a new support center.
examples.zh: 客户来电被转接到新的客服中心。

definition.en: directed along a different route; changed in path (often used to describe traffic, shipments, flights, or calls).
definition.zh: 被改道的；路线被更改的（常用于交通、货运、航班或电话转接等）。

examples.en: Rerouted buses will stop at the temporary station.
examples.zh: 改道的公交车将停靠临时车站。

examples.en: We followed the rerouted path around the construction site.
examples.zh: 我们沿着改道后的路线绕开了施工区域。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新/改”，加上“route（路线）”，合起来就是“重新规划路线、改道”。
注意拼写与发音：美式中“route”常读 /raʊt/（像“rout”），所以“rerouted”常读 /ˌriˈraʊtɪd/。在不同地区也可能听到“route”读 /ruːt/。

summary.en: “Reroutes” usually means “changes to a different route,” and it can be a verb (he/she/it reroutes) or a plural noun (reroutes).
summary.zh: “Reroutes”通常表示“改道/重新规划路线”，既可作动词第三人称单数（reroutes），也可作名词复数（reroutes）。

definition.en: (of a person, company, or system) changes the route or direction of something, usually to avoid a problem or improve efficiency.
definition.zh: （人、公司或系统）改变某物的路线或方向，通常是为了避开问题或提高效率。

examples.en: The airline reroutes flights around the storm.
examples.zh: 航空公司把航班改道以避开暴风雨。

examples.en: If traffic is heavy, the app reroutes you to a faster road.
examples.zh: 如果交通拥堵，导航应用会把你重新规划到更快的道路。

definition.en: plural of “reroute”: alternative routes chosen to replace the original one.
definition.zh: “reroute”的复数：用来替代原路线的改道路线/绕行路线。

examples.en: Several reroutes are available while the bridge is closed.
examples.zh: 桥梁封闭期间有几条可选的绕行路线。

examples.en: The map shows reroutes for buses during the parade.
examples.zh: 地图显示了游行期间公交车的改道路线。

extraExplanation: “reroute”由 re-（再次/重新）+ route（路线）构成，常用于交通、物流、网络（数据包路径）等场景。
注意拼写：英式英语里也常见 route 的发音差异，但拼写通常不变；“reroute”在美式里常读作“ree-ROUT”。

summary.en: Rerouting means changing to a different route, especially for traffic, travel, delivery, or network data.
summary.zh: Rerouting 指“改道/重新规划路线”，常用于交通出行、物流配送或网络数据传输。

definition.en: the act or process of sending traffic, people, or information by a different route than originally planned
definition.zh: 改道；重新规划路线（把车辆、人或信息从原定路线改走另一条路的过程）

examples.en: Due to road construction, there will be rerouting around the downtown area.
examples.zh: 由于道路施工，市中心周边将进行改道。

examples.en: The airline announced rerouting because of severe weather.
examples.zh: 航空公司因恶劣天气宣布航线改道。

examples.en: Network rerouting helped keep the website online during the outage.
examples.zh: 网络改路由帮助网站在故障期间保持在线。

definition.en: changing the route of something; directing it to go another way
definition.zh: 正在改道的；把……改走另一条路径的

examples.en: Rerouting traffic will reduce congestion near the bridge.
examples.zh: 将车流改道会减少桥附近的拥堵。

examples.en: We’re rerouting deliveries to avoid the closed highway.
examples.zh: 我们正在把送货路线改道，以避开封闭的高速公路。

extraExplanation: “Rerouting”常见于交通与物流语境，也常用于计算机网络：例如路由器在某条线路故障时，会把数据包自动“改道”到可用路径，以保持连接稳定。
拼写上是 re-（再次）+ route（路线）+ -ing（名词化/进行时形式）。在美式英语中，route 常读作 /raʊt/，因此 rerouting 常读 /ˌriˈraʊtɪŋ/。

summary.en: Rerow means to row again (most common), and less commonly to rearrange into rows again.
summary.zh: Rerow 常指“再次划船/划回去”，较少见指“重新排成行、调整行顺序”。

definition.en: to row (a boat) again, or to row back over the same route
definition.zh: 再次划船；（沿同一路线）再划一遍/划回去

examples.en: The wind turned, so they had to rerow to the shore.
examples.zh: 风向变了，所以他们不得不再划回岸边。

examples.en: If we miss the marker, we’ll rerow the last section.
examples.zh: 如果我们错过标记点，就把最后那一段再划一遍。

definition.en: (less common) to arrange something into rows again; to put into a new row order
definition.zh: （较少见）重新排成行；重新调整行的顺序

examples.en: After adding new data, she rerowed the table to group items by date.
examples.zh: 加入新数据后，她把表格重新按日期分组排列各行。

extraExplanation: “rerow”由前缀 re-（“再一次/重新”）+ row（划船/排成行）构成。写作时更常见的形式是带连字符的“re-row”，尤其在不常见或可能引起歧义时。

summary.en: “Reroyalize” means to make something royal again or restore a monarchy/royal status.
summary.zh: “reroyalize”表示“使再次王室化/恢复王权或王室地位”。

definition.en: to make someone or something royal again; to restore royal status, privileges, or a monarchy after it has been removed
definition.zh: 使再次成为王室/恢复王权；在王室地位或君主制被取消后，使其重新获得王室身份或特权

examples.en: After the revolution, some groups tried to reroyalize the country by bringing back the monarchy.
examples.zh: 革命之后，一些团体试图通过恢复君主制来让国家“重新王室化”。

examples.en: The novelist imagines a future where the old family is reroyalized and returns to the palace.
examples.zh: 这位小说家想象了一个未来：旧王族被重新册封并回到宫殿。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、带有“造词感”的动词，常见构词法是 re-（再次）+ royalize（使王室化）。在新闻/历史讨论中偶尔用于谈“复辟、恢复王室地位”，也可能带一点讽刺或文学夸张的语气。
更常见、更自然的表达通常是 restore the monarchy（恢复君主制）、reinstate the royal family（恢复王室）、re-enthrone（使复位/复辟）、re-crown（再次加冕）。

summary.en: Rerub means to rub something again, usually to clean, polish, or spread something more evenly.
summary.zh: rerub 指把某物再擦一次/再揉搓一次，常用于清洁、抛光或让涂抹更均匀。

definition.en: to rub again; to apply rubbing a second time, often to clean, polish, or spread something more evenly
definition.zh: 再擦；再揉搓；再次用摩擦的方式处理（常为清洁、抛光或涂抹更均匀）

examples.en: The stain didn’t come out, so she rerubbed the spot with soap.
examples.zh: 污渍没去掉，所以她又用肥皂把那一块重新擦了一遍。

examples.en: If the lotion feels uneven, rerub it into your skin.
examples.zh: 如果乳液涂得不均匀，就再把它揉搓进皮肤里。

examples.en: After the wax dried, he rerubbed the table to make it shine.
examples.zh: 蜡干了之后，他又把桌子重新擦了一遍，让它更亮。

extraExplanation: “rerub”由前缀 re-（再次）+ rub（擦、揉搓）组成，意思直观，常用于需要“重复同一动作”的场景（清洁、护肤、抛光、处理污渍等）。在正式写作中也可用 “rub again / rub it again” 来表达，更自然常见。

summary.en: “Rerummage” means to rummage again—to search through things again, often in a hurried, messy way.
summary.zh: “rerummage”指“再次翻找”，常带有匆忙、把东西翻乱的感觉。

definition.en: to rummage again; to search through things again in a rough or hurried way (often because you didn’t find what you needed the first time)
definition.zh: 再翻找；再次（匆忙地）翻弄、搜寻（常因第一次没找到）

examples.en: I rerummaged my backpack but still couldn’t find my keys.
examples.zh: 我又把背包翻了一遍，但还是找不到钥匙。

examples.en: She rerummaged the drawer for the receipt she was sure she had kept.
examples.zh: 她又把抽屉翻找了一遍，想找那张她确定保存过的收据。

extraExplanation: “rerummage”= re-（再次）+ rummage（翻找、乱翻）。它不是很常见，但在口语或写作中可以用来强调“又翻了一遍”。
“rummage”通常带有“把东西翻得有点乱、很急”的感觉；如果只是更有条理地找，可以用“search again / look again”。

summary.en: Rerun means to do something again or to broadcast a TV program again; it can also mean the repeat broadcast itself.
summary.zh: rerun 指“再次运行/重新进行”，也指节目“重播”；还可作名词表示“重播的节目/集数”。

definition.en: to run again; to repeat an action or process
definition.zh: 再次运行；重新进行某个动作或流程

examples.en: If the program crashes, save your work and rerun it.
examples.zh: 如果程序崩溃了，先保存工作，然后重新运行它。

examples.en: They had to rerun the experiment because the first results were unclear.
examples.zh: 因为第一次结果不清楚，他们不得不重新做实验。

definition.en: (of a TV show, movie, etc.) to be broadcast again
definition.zh: （电视节目、电影等）重播

examples.en: The channel will rerun the series this weekend.
examples.zh: 这个频道周末会重播这部剧。

examples.en: They reran the interview after receiving many requests.
examples.zh: 因为很多人要求，他们把那段采访重播了一次。

definition.en: a repeat broadcast of a TV show, episode, or program
definition.zh: （电视节目/剧集的）重播；重播的那一集/那一期

examples.en: I missed the episode, so I watched the rerun the next day.
examples.zh: 我错过了那一集，所以第二天看了重播。

examples.en: The summer schedule is full of reruns.
examples.zh: 暑期节目表里到处都是重播。

extraExplanation: “rerun”既可作动词也可作名词。作名词时在美式英语里很常见，尤其指电视节目“重播”。
书写上常见作一个词“rerun”；也有人写作“re-run”，但现代用法里合写更普遍。

summary.en: “Rerunning” means doing something again—often re-running a process/program/test or re-airing a TV show.
summary.zh: “Rerunning”指把某事再做一次——常见于重新运行流程/程序/测试，或电视节目重播。

definition.en: the act of doing, running, or performing something again (especially a process, program, or test)
definition.zh: 重新运行；再次执行（尤指流程、程序或测试）

examples.en: After fixing the bug, we’re rerunning the test.
examples.zh: 修复漏洞后，我们正在重新运行测试。

examples.en: Rerunning the analysis gave the same result.
examples.zh: 重新运行分析得到了相同的结果。

definition.en: doing or running something again; repeating a run or performance
definition.zh: 正在重新运行；再次执行；重跑/重演

examples.en: The script is rerunning because the server restarted.
examples.zh: 由于服务器重启，这个脚本正在重新运行。

examples.en: I’m rerunning the washing machine cycle to get the clothes cleaner.
examples.zh: 我在把洗衣机的洗涤程序再运行一次，让衣服更干净。

definition.en: broadcasting or showing a TV show, movie, or episode again (a repeat)
definition.zh: （电视/节目）重播；再次播出

examples.en: They’re rerunning last night’s episode this afternoon.
examples.zh: 他们今天下午会重播昨晚那一集。

examples.en: The channel is rerunning old sitcoms all weekend.
examples.zh: 这个频道整个周末都在重播老情景喜剧。

extraExplanation: “rerun”= re-（再次）+ run（运行/播出）。在日常英语里，它既常用于“电脑程序/流程重新运行”，也常用于“电视节目重播”。
拼写注意：rerun 的现在分词要双写 n → rerunning（类似 run → running）。

summary.en: “Reruns” usually means repeated showings of a program; it can also be the verb “to rerun,” meaning to run or show again.
summary.zh: “reruns”通常指节目等的重播；也可作动词“rerun”的第三人称，表示再运行或重播。

definition.en: repeated showings of a TV program, movie, or broadcast that has been shown before
definition.zh: （电视节目、电影或播出内容的）重播；重映

examples.en: There’s nothing new on tonight—just reruns.
examples.zh: 今晚没什么新节目——只有重播。

examples.en: I grew up watching reruns of old sitcoms.
examples.zh: 我小时候常看老情景喜剧的重播。

definition.en: to run, broadcast, or show again
definition.zh: 再运行；重播；重放；重映

examples.en: They rerun the episode every summer.
examples.zh: 他们每年夏天都会重播那一集。

examples.en: If the test fails, rerun it with the correct settings.
examples.zh: 如果测试失败，就用正确的设置重新运行。

extraExplanation: “rerun”最常见于电视语境，指“播过的节目再次播放”。在科技语境中也很常见，比如“rerun a program/script”（重新运行程序/脚本）。
口语里常说“a rerun of + 节目名”（某节目的一次重播）；复数“reruns”常用来概括“都是重播内容”。
